Peaceful solution to nuclear issue of Korean Peninsula called for
articles.content:
Peaceful solution to nuclear issue of Korean Peninsula called for
    Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- The Australian Peace Committee and Australian organizations of global friends issued a joint statement on June 10 calling for a peaceful solution to the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula.
 The statement denounced the united states for insisting on hard-line steps such as military option and sanctions against the DPRK over the nuclear issue, adding that these actions should be completely eliminated and any form of pressure against the DPRK will produce a contrary result.    
 The way of solving the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula is for the present U.S. administration to ease the situation, and put all the processes, which were promoted during the former Clinton administration, on their original track, it held.

articles.title: Korean people's struggle for national reunification supported
articles.content:
Korean people's struggle for national reunification supported
    Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- Korea should be reunified independently and peacefully by the united efforts of the Koreans in the north and the south at an early date, said Philip Mangula, Secretary General of the Revolutionary Party of Tanzania, when he met outgoing DPRK Ambassador to Tanzania Ro Min Su.
 The secretary general supported the stand and efforts of the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government for the peaceful solution of the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula through the DPRK-U.S. dialogue and the reunification of the peninsula.    
 The friendly and cooperative relations between the RPT and the WPK and between the two countries are historic relations that were provided and have been developed on the basis of the close relationship between President Kim Il Sung and former President Julius K. Nyerere, he said, adding: The two parties and the two countries have maintained the common stand toward a lot of matters and supported and cooperated with each other and will make efforts to continue developing the relations in the future, too.

Greetings to President of Seychelles
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Seychelles
    Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on June 16 sent a message of greetings to France Albert Rene, President of Seychelles, on the occasion of its National Day.
 The message warmly congratulated the president, government and people of Seychelles on the occasion.    
 It wished the president greater success in his responsible work for the prosperity and progress of the country and hoped that the excellent friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future.
